intro: Paesia lamiana, commonly known as the common paesia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It is an annual or biennial herb that reaches heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its aromatic foliage and early blooming period make it a notable species in its native habitats.
